ssnapstats 0.0.1
  • Reference

Defines the global constant for SSNAP 'level colours' for domains and overall scoring

Source: R/ssnapcolours.R
ssnapcolours.Rd

ssnapcolours is a constant set of character-based colour definitions, representing the SSNAP levels

ssnapcolours

Format

An object of class character of length 5.

Value

A vector containing the colours used to represent scoring levels used in the SSNAP acute audit.

Details

SSNAP scores and domains are rated 'A-E'. Each level is also defined by a colour from light green ('A') to red ('E') This constant defines those colours in a vector which is used in conjunction with many processes. ALWAYS use this vector when using colours rather than trying to define or select them elsewhere. This means if we wanted to change them this would be a single point change for the entire toolset. You can assume in future that this will always be a vector of characters, but not how many items there are or what their constants are. You should never assume there will only be 5 levels, as this might change in future - so if you need to loop through levels you should count the size of this vector to indicate how many items you are dealing with.

Examples

ssnapcolours
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ssnapcolours' not found
